contents.verseText: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved fellow worker,
contents: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,
To Philemon our beloved fellow worker,

contents.verseText: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets at your house:
contents: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets at your

footnote.ft: You and Your are singular throughout this letter, except in verses 3, 22, and 25.

contents: house:

contents.verseText: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
contents: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

contents.verseText: I always thank my God, remembering you in my prayers,
contents: I always thank my God, remembering you in my prayers,

contents.verseText: because I hear about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints.
contents: because I hear about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints.

contents.verseText: I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective as you fully acknowledge every good thing that is ours in Christ.
contents: I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective as you fully acknowledge every good thing that is ours in Christ.

contents.verseText: I take great joy and encouragement in your love, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the saints.
contents: I take great joy and encouragement in your love, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the saints.

contents.verseText: So although in Christ I am bold enough to order you to do what is proper,
contents: So although in Christ I am bold enough to order you to do what is proper,

contents.verseText: I prefer to appeal on the basis of love. For I, Paul, am now aged, and a prisoner of Christ Jesus as well.
contents: I prefer to appeal on the basis of love. For I, Paul, am now aged, and a prisoner of Christ Jesus as well.

contents.verseText: I appeal to you for my child Onesimus, whose father I became while I was in chains.
contents: I appeal to you for my child Onesimus,

footnote.ft: Onesimus means useful (see verse 11) or beneficial (see verse 20).

contents: whose father I became while I was in chains.

contents.verseText: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.
contents: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

contents.verseText: I am sending back to you him who is my very heart.
contents: I am sending back to you him who is my very heart.

contents.verseText: I would have liked to keep him with me, so that on your behalf he could minister to me in my chains for the gospel.
contents: I would have liked to keep him with me, so that on your behalf he could minister to me in my chains for the gospel.

contents.verseText: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness will not be out of compulsion, but by your own free will.
contents: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness will not be out of compulsion, but by your own free will.

contents.verseText: For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for good—
contents: For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for good—

contents.verseText: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a beloved brother. He is especially beloved to me, but even more so to you, both in person and in the Lord.
contents: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a beloved brother. He is especially beloved to me, but even more so to you, both in person and in the Lord.

contents.verseText: So if you consider me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.
contents: So if you consider me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.

contents.verseText: But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to my account.
contents: But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

contents.verseText: I, Paul, write this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me your very self.
contents: I, Paul, write this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

contents.verseText: Yes, brother, let me have some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.
contents: Yes, brother, let me have some benefit

footnote.ft: Greek onaimēn, a play on the name Onesimus

contents: from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

contents.verseText: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.
contents: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

contents.verseText: In the meantime, prepare a guest room for me, because I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
contents: In the meantime, prepare a guest room for me, because I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

contents.verseText: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,
contents: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,

contents.verseText: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
contents: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

contents.verseText: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
contents: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
